meanings.definition: To cut or clip with quick, short movements.
meanings.sent1: She snipped the thread with scissors.
meanings.sent2: The hairdresser snipped away at the split ends.
meanings.sent3: The tailor snipped the fabric into a funny shape by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The chef snipped fresh herbs from the garden for the dish.
meanings.sent5: The gardener snipped the overgrown bushes into beautiful shapes.

meanings.sent2: The snipped of cloth was too small to use for the project.

meanings.sent4: The artist used snipped of colored paper to create a collage.
meanings.sent5: The child proudly showed off his snipped of the puzzle he completed.
